answer.content:
Topological Sort

Topological Sort is a data structure that sorts an array of elements based on the order of their appearance in the input array. It works by maintaining two pointers, one at the beginning and one at the end of the array, and moving them along the array until they meet. The elements are then swapped if they are in different orders.
